summary: States contract with managed care plans to pay for Medicaid services. Plans can generally keep Medicaid funds that aren't spent on services, which may create incentives for plans to deny services. Managed care plans require providers to get prior authorization for some services to ensure they're needed. title: Medicaid: Managed Care Plans’ Prior Authorization Decisions for Children Need Additional Oversight
